titlestmt.titleproper: E. Backus account with Backus and Brisbin, Mexico 1883-1889
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: E. Backus account with Backus and Brisbin, Mexico
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Backus and Brisbin were a construction firm. The firm did business in New Orleans, Mexico, and Brazil.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of accounts payable and receivable related to business expenditures of the firm of Backus and Brisbin. The entries include payments for construction-related materials such as galvanized iron, hardware, coal, as well as for general business expenses, such as stationery and advertising.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.
